body.p: The boards decided that an entity should disregard any contractual or practical limitations when it assesses the ‘simultaneously receives and consumes’ criterion and whether another entity would need to substantially re‑perform the performance completed to date. This is because the objective of this criterion is to determine whether control of the goods or services has already been transferred to the customer. This is done by using a hypothetical assessment of what another entity would need to do if it were to take over the remaining performance. Thus, actual practical or contractual limitations on the remaining performance would have no bearing on the assessment of whether the entity has transferred control of the goods or services provided to date.
